result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason J Tepley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AODA & comply with treatment recommendations., Complete and comply with Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program. 
No contact with Tracy Meddaugh or Kaleb Meddagh, Restitution TBD, 
Pay costs with Domestic Abuse Surcharge.  
Provide a DNA sample and pay surcharges. 
Not eligible for ER or Challenge programs. 
No credit.

Transcript of Sentencing hearing held on 02/24/14
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Jason J Tepley in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases today 13CM434 and 14CF30.  Court has PSI from previous file. 
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
13CM434: 42 days Jail - 42 days credit, - time served, pay costs.
14CF30: CT 1 & 3:  5 yrs Prison at 2 yr In and 3 yrs ES, consecutive to 13CM434, but concurrent to any other sentence
Conditions:  AODA & comply with treatment recommendations., Complete and comply with DAAP program. No contact with Tracy Meddaugh or Kaleb Meddagh, Restitution TBD, Pay costs with Domestic Abuse Surcharge.

Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 13CM434 and 14CF30 ct 1 & 3: No Contests
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CM434 and 14CF30 ct 1 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 14CF30 Ct 2 is Dismissed Read In.

ADA Isherwood makes sentencing statements.
Atty Sheets concurs with the Joint recommendation, and request the no contact with Tracy be determined by Agent and Tracy, if to allow contact.

BTC:
14CM434: Poss THC 961.41(3g)(e): 42 days jail - credit 42 days already served, Pay costs at 25% of prison account.

14CF30 Ct 1:  Subs Battery-repeater 940.19(2):***********Prison Sentence**************  Determinated
 5 yrs Prison at 2 yr In and 3 yrs ES, consecutive to 13CM434, but concurrent with 12CF49
Conditions:  AODA & comply with treatment recommendations., Complete and comply with Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program. No contact with Tracy Meddaugh or Kaleb Meddagh, Restitution TBD, Pay costs with Domestic Abuse Surcharge. 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  Provide a DNA sample and pay surcharges. Not eligible for ER or Challenge programs.

14CF30 Ct 2: Child Abuse Reckless-repeater 948.03(3)(b):   
5 yrs Prison at 2 yr In and 3 yrs ES, consecutive to 13CM434, but concurrent with Count 1 and 12CF49.  Comply with conditions in Ct 1

Remanded to the Sheriff Dept
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jason J Tepley appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Veronica Isherwood appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Eric Sheets in court. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Veronica Isherwood appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Isherwood states facts for anticipated charges of Substantial Battery/Disorderly Conduct.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender.
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant has not been seen by the Public Defender's office today. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  01/27/14   @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3

Defendant is employed at Golden County Foods.  He is on Probation at this time with agent Ben Jed.  Unsure if he will be revoked. 
Atty Isherwood states recommendations for bond. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court.  Cannot afford a cash bond.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
No contact with Tracy and Caleb Meddaugh, direct or indirect. 
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment and programming.  Required to initially day report 7 times per week.  If they would like to reduce that to a lower amount, they can.
